modules.title: FedRAMP Basics
modules.description: Learn the fundamental concepts of FedRAMP and its purpose in cloud security
objectives: Understand what FedRAMP is and why it exists
Learn about the key stakeholders in FedRAMP
Identify the benefits of FedRAMP for cloud providers and agencies

content.title: What is FedRAMP?
content.content: FedRAMP (Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program) is a government-wide program that provides a standardized approach to security assessment, authorization, and continuous monitoring for cloud products and services.

content.title: Key Components
content.content: FedRAMP consists of three main components: Security Assessment, Authorization, and Continuous Monitoring.

quiz.question: What does FedRAMP stand for?
options: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program
Federal Risk and Assessment Management Process

modules.title: Security Controls
modules.description: Deep dive into NIST 800-53 security controls and their implementation
objectives: Learn about control families and their purposes
Identify implementation guidance for key controls

content.title: NIST 800-53 Overview
content.content: NIST Special Publication 800-53 provides a catalog of security and privacy controls for federal information systems and organizations.

content.title: Control Families
content.content: Security controls are organized into 20 families, each addressing different aspects of security such as Access Control, Audit and Accountability, and Configuration Management.

quiz.question: How many control families are there in NIST 800-53?

modules.title: Assessment Process
modules.description: Understanding the FedRAMP assessment and authorization process
objectives: Learn the phases of FedRAMP assessment

content.title: Assessment Overview
content.content: The FedRAMP assessment process involves multiple phases including preparation, assessment, and authorization.

content.title: Key Phases
content.content: The process includes Pre-Assessment, Assessment, and Post-Assessment phases, each with specific activities and deliverables.

quiz.question: What is the first phase of the FedRAMP assessment process?

modules.title: Compliance Management
modules.description: Maintaining compliance through continuous monitoring and reporting

content.title: Continuous Monitoring
content.content: FedRAMP requires ongoing monitoring of security controls to ensure they remain effective over time.

content.title: Reporting Requirements
content.content: Organizations must provide regular reports including monthly operating status, annual assessments, and incident reports.

quiz.question: How often must CSPs provide operational status reports?

modules.title: Risk Management Framework
modules.description: Understanding the RMF process and its integration with FedRAMP
objectives: Understand how RMF integrates with FedRAMP

content.title: Risk Management Framework
content.content: The RMF provides a disciplined and structured process for integrating security and risk management activities into the system development life cycle.

content.title: Six Steps of RMF
content.content: The RMF consists of six steps: Categorize, Select, Implement, Assess, Authorize, and Monitor.

quiz.question: What is the first step in the RMF process?

modules.title: Cloud Security Fundamentals
modules.description: Essential cloud security concepts and best practices

content.title: Cloud Service Models
content.content: Cloud computing offers three main service models: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS).

content.title: Shared Responsibility
content.content: Cloud security operates on a shared responsibility model where both the cloud provider and customer have specific security obligations.

quiz.question: Which cloud service model provides the most customer control?
